intro: Lophozonia menziesii, commonly known as the Menzies' lophozonia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is native to western North America, particularly found in regions of the Pacific Northwest. The plant is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale green. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Lophozonia menziesii is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and support local biodiversity.
